intro: Echium micranthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has slender, hairy stems and linear leaves that are often arranged in a spiral pattern. Echium micranthum is known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
